TopicTitle: South-West Launch Site - Kerbal Konstructs Content

Articles.Content:
Australia? Awww. Ok I can also place a dirt pad at my location in new zealand with some sheep standing around.

Your mod looks amazing, you work so fast! Cant wait
Beale, you rock. Love your texturing work sir.

> 
> I think I am needing significantly more distance from VAB to launchpad!

you and anyone trying to not make a disaster due to a failure caused by many budget constraints added to apparent external factors...

> 
> you and anyone trying to not make a disaster due to a failure caused by many budget constraints added to apparent external factors...

You are the number 1 poster for humerous comments I love it

> 
> Much awesome. Very wow.

> 
> Australia? Awww. Ok I can also place a dirt pad at my location in new zealand with some sheep standing around.
> Your mod looks amazing, you work so fast! Cant wait

> 
> Beale, you rock. Love your texturing work sir.

Really nice to hear! Many thanks folks ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) (And thanks for the link in KK thread AlphaAsh!)

New crawlerway, 0.1km long (vs. the 50m long previous design) and with tracks.

![85d8bcf6e6.jpg](http://puu.sh/jkx9c/85d8bcf6e6.jpg)

![02f12bcd5c.jpg](http://puu.sh/jkuoU/02f12bcd5c.jpg)

![68fa65cb2d.jpg](http://puu.sh/jkuzd/68fa65cb2d.jpg)

Also a slightly better location has been found. An even smaller island about 100km north of the last location, which by a small chance has a plot of *perfectly* flat terrain

![d99a722106.jpg](http://puu.sh/jkuHZ/d99a722106.jpg)

Scouting is a wonderful adventure!

![7482be8024.jpg](http://puu.sh/jkuTD/7482be8024.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-31T20:44:07Z" title="07/31/2015 08:44  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 31, 2015</time> by Beale**
Woah, cool! Can we get some pictures of it on the current island?
Okay that plane is just sooooo cute. You should call it the Bealey.

I get the feeling I will ne having a missle fight between locations lol using smart parts mod.

Buy seriously This mod is awesome

Beale, two questions:

1 - Up to what rocket size is this pad designed? Or can I launch a Saturn V-24(L) in it?

2 - Is a alternate pad Like Gagarin's pad planned?

![article-1372645-0B72729800000578-416_634x344.jpg](http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2011/04/02/article-1372645-0B72729800000578-416_634x344.jpg)

Hey I can make these launch clamps...

Interrsted?

> 
> Beale, two questions:
> 1 - Up to what rocket size is this pad designed? Or can I launch a Saturn V-24(L) in it?
> 
> 2 - Is a alternate pad Like Gagarin's pad planned?
> 
> [http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2011/04/02/article-1372645-0B72729800000578-416_634x344.jpg](http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2011/04/02/article-1372645-0B72729800000578-416_634x344.jpg)

That pad is designed to launch the Black Arrow rocket from Tantares, which is 1.875 metres.
So, is this going to evolve into a pack of several KK launch sites, or is the Woomera one the only site you plan on doing?

> 
> Woah, cool! Can we get some pictures of it on the current island?

Heavy WIP!

It has a name now, *San Gallo*!

A question though, how long must a runway be to comfortably land and take off? 1km? 2km?

It doesn't need to be the length of KSC for sure, but I'm not sure how small it can be.

![11a5b47adb.jpg](http://puu.sh/jlqrs/11a5b47adb.jpg)

![0cb89171c2.jpg](http://puu.sh/jlqs5/0cb89171c2.jpg)

> 
> Okay that plane is just sooooo cute. You should call it the Bealey.

Many thanks! It flies like a dream ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

> 
> Beale, two questions:
> 1 - Up to what rocket size is this pad designed? Or can I launch a Saturn V-24(L) in it?
> 
> 2 - Is a alternate pad Like Gagarin's pad planned?

1. There are no size / weight limits, but the pad itself is only 8 metres across. 

2. Not at the moment.

> 
> So, is this going to evolve into a pack of several KK launch sites, or is the Woomera one the only site you plan on doing?

Beyond Woomera there are some assets kindly made by SnowWhite to create the N-1 Rocket Launch facility, so that ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Hey I can make these launch clamps...
> Interrsted?

Many thanks for the kind offer, but for the time being no plans ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-01T15:37:18Z" title="08/01/2015 03:37  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 1, 2015</time> by Beale**
I'd say 1.25 km for a runway wouldn't be bad.
Looking very cool Beale! Not sure how long a runway would have to be but just...enough.
this is space this is base

Awesome, I would love to try this out! New Zealand is just a short ocean hop away from where I am.

In fact, I'd never tried to launch a high inclination sat before. This would be an awesome first time ^^
I would love for this to be released!
Woomera is west of me ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif). I like it somewhere in the desert though, too bad the desert biome is tiny.

oh, this is exciting ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

And I love that plane! What propeller is that? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
So has there been any progress on this recently?

> 
> So has there been any progress on this recently?

It needs to be reworked due to a few placement bugs I found.

Expect the new launch site to be sea based.
This should be the Tier 0 building!
This is the first stockalike launch site I've seen! I like it!

> Hey I can make these launch clamps...
